comment.author: 68061336@N05
comment._content: Cou;ld this be Lieutenant Colonel A R Nethersole as no WW1 medal record for A N Lieutenant Colonel A R Nethersole's death is recorded by CWCG as follows Name: NETHERSOLE Initials: A R Nationality: Indian Rank: Lieutenant Colonel Regiment/Service: 83rd Wallajahbad Light Infantry Date of Death: 30/12/1915 Casualty Type: Commonwealth War Dead Memorial: CHATBY MEMORIAL www.cwgc.org/search/casualty_details.aspx?casualty=1438936

comment.author: 68061336@N05
comment._content: Masonic Lodge records seem to confirm above as photo matches www.masonicgreatwarproject.org.uk/writeup.php?string=2237

comment.author: 74737962@N04
comment._content:
Alfred Ralph Nethersole, born in Deal in Kent, 1867.
His father John was a farmer and wine merchant (in 1871 census).  Like John, Alfred R attended Cambridge University - he started in 1887 and was not attached to a college. Three of his brothers also studied there. He was commissioned in the Royal Scots Fusilers in 1888, then joined the Indian Army the same year.
When he died, his UK address was 49a Loughton Grove, Sydenham, Kent.  His widow was Marian Alfreda Cairns Nethersole.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: As per masonic site above, died on passenger ship SS Persia. Wikipedia article quote "Persia was sunk off Crete, while the passengers were having lunch, on 30 December 1915, by German World War I U-Boat ace Max Valentiner (commanding U-38). The Persia sank in five to ten minutes, killing 343 of the 519 aboard. The sinking was highly controversial, since it broke naval international law, or the "Cruiser Rules", that stated merchant shipping carrying passengers should be given opportunity for the passengers to disembark before combat could commence. A warning shot across the bow should have been given first. Instead, the U-Boat fired a torpedo with no warning." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_Persia_%281900%29

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: In 1881 Census, Aldred (sic) R Nethersole age 13, Frederick E (sic) Nethersole age 15 and Percy R. Nethersole age 11, were all born in Deal Kent and are boarders at the Village Grammar Sch belonging to Cloth Workers Coy, Sutton-Valence, Kent Cambridge Colleges/library online folio venn.lib.cam.ac.uk William 1855–1888, Frederick Ralph 1865-1933, Alfred Ralph 1867-1965 (sic), Charles Ralph 1872-1970, all are sons of John Nethersole of Ham, Sandwich. Kent ; attended school Sutton Valence School Sutton Valence, Kent and attended Cambridge Univ William Nethersole, Court Judge: Nagpur, India 1883 Frederick Ralph Nethersole WW1 Lieutenant-Colonel: Supernumerary List, Indian Army Alfred Ralph Nethersole b Apr. 18, 1867, Second Lieut., Royal Scots Fusiliers, 1888; Lieut., Indian Staff Corps, 1891, Capt., Indian Army, 1899; Adjutant, Indian Volunteers, 1895-1900. Recruiting Staff-Officer, India, 1902-5; Major 1906. venn.lib.cam.ac.uk/cgi-bin/search.pl?sur=nethersole&s... Charles Ralph Nethersole last info noted is matric
